definition:
A sort of wild ox; a buffalo. E. Phillips.

1. A horn used by hunters. 2. (Mus.)  A copper instrument of the horn quality of tone, shorter and more conical that the trumpet, sometimes keyed; formerly much used in military bands, very rarely in the orchestra; now superseded by the cornet; -- called also the Kent bugle.

An elingated glass bead, of various colors, though commonly black.

Jet black. "Bugle eyeballs." Shak.
